subject: Entrepreneurship
title: When Bootstrapping Doesn't Work
description: A 60-second lesson on When Bootstrapping Doesn't Work.

hook.text: You can't bootstrap a rocket company. SpaceX needed $100M before a single launch.

buildup.text: Some businesses need massive upfront capital: hardware, biotech, regulated industries.

discovery.text: Winner-take-all markets also resist bootstrapping. Moving slowly means losing to a funded competitor.

twist.text: Even Basecamp's founders admit: bootstrapping only works when the market allows gradual growth.

climax.text: The right question isn't 'should I bootstrap?' It's 'does my market reward speed or patience?'

punchline.text: Bootstrapping is a choiceâ€”but only when the market gives you one.

quiz.question: When is bootstrapping typically not viable?
options: In capital-intensive or winner-take-all markets requiring large upfront investment
When the founder has prior startup experience
